entry.title: Lisette Olivera (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that National Treasure: Edge of History lead Lisette Olivera (pictured) was dissuaded from an acting career as a child but studied dance, vocals and music?

entry.title: Pania Newton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand activist Pania Newton gave up a legal career to become an activist and spokesperson for the preservation of her ancestral lands at Ihumātao?

entry.title: Poison Ivy: Thorns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the writer of Poison Ivy: Thorns felt the titular DC Comics character was "tailor made for [her] interests as a nature-loving, gay makeup enthusiast"?

entry.title: Beverly Robertson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one of Beverly Robertson's biggest accomplishments as CEO of the Greater Memphis Chamber was attracting the Ford Motor Company's US$5.6 billion Blue Oval City complex to Memphis, Tennessee?

entry.title: Shiroi Heya no Futari (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shiroi Heya no Futari is regarded as the first work of yuri, a genre of manga and other media focused on female-female romance, despite not being the first manga to depict romance between women?

entry.title: Nilofer Khan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nilofer Khan was appointed the first woman vice-chancellor of the University of Kashmir on 19 May 2022?

entry.title: Joanna E. Schanz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Joanna E. Schanz, who received a lifetime achievement award, revived broom making and basket weaving in the Amana Colonies?

entry.title: a locally developed diagnostic probe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a locally developed diagnostic probe is used for breast cancer surgeries in Iran?
